head.title: COVID-19 Extended Closure Information - MSD Lawrence Township

meta.name: author
meta.content: Metropolitan School District of Lawrence Township

meta.name: IconImage

input.name: lng
__VIEWSTATEGENERATOR

span.strong: At the direction of Governor Holcomb, there will be no onsite classes for the remainder of the 2019-2020 academic school year due to COVID-19 pandemic. Offsite eLearning will take place. There will be no preschool programming or child care available. All extra curriculuar activities will be canceled for the remainder of the academic year. LECC will be closed to the public. Click here to see the Coronavirus Communication announcement below for the most current information.

p.br:
The World Health Organization (WHO) has determined the COVID-19 (Coronavirus) virus to be a pandemic and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) consider COVID-19 to be a serious public health threat. At the direction of Indiana Governor, Eric Holcomb, onsite classes are cancelled for the duration of the spring semester. Students and staff will engage in off-site eLearning. There will be no preschool programming or child care on site. Only essential staff should report to work.
Information specific to seniors is forthcoming from building principals.
Click here to read Indiana State Board of Education Flexibility from Indiana Graduation Requirements in Response to COVID-19.
eLearning & Devices
The district implemented eLearning Monday, March 16 through the end of the academic year.

p.a: Follow this link to access extended closure eLearning resources.

br.br:
Families needing district device repair should click here to submit a repair request prior to dropping off the device. Follow this link to submit a repair request. All devices submitted will be quarantined for one week to ensure the health and safety of technicians. Parents/guardians will be notified directly when the device is ready for pick up. We will accept Chromebook returns for withdrawing students. Drop off locations are Fall Creek Valley Middle School, Lawrence Central High School, and Lawrence North High School on Mondays between 11 AM - 2 PM. A building technician will be present to accept the device.Â
Follow the links below to read an important letter from Dr. Smith on the 20 Instructional Day Waiver from the Indiana Department of Education.
Dr. Smith Waiver Days Letter - English
Dr. Smith Waiver Days Letter - Spanish
Follow this link to view the MSD of Lawrence Township's continuous learning plan.

br.strong: Offline Instructional Materials For Those Unable To Participate In eLearning

br.br:
Paper packets will be available at all schools on April 13 for the week of April 6 & April 13 between 11 AM â€“ 3 PM.
Paper packets will be avilable at all schools for the week's instruction on April 20 & 27 between 11 AM - 3 PM.
Elementary students completing paper packets will be contacted by their teacher for progress checking and feedback.
Food Services Information
A five day supply of Grab & Go breakfasts and lu nches will be available on Mondays, April 6, 3, 20, & 27 between 11 AM - 1 PM.
Sites for pick up are listed below:
Brook Park Elementary: 5259 David Street, Indianapolis, IN 46226
Harrison Hill Elementary: 7510 East 53rd Street, Indianapolis, IN 46226
Indian Creek Elementary: 10833 East 56th Street, Indianapolis, IN 46235
Fall Creek Valley Middle School: 9701 East 63rd Street, Indianapolis, IN 46236
Lawrence North High School: 7802 Hague Road, Indianapolis, IN 46256
Meals can also be picked up at the following COMMUNITY satellite locations on Mondays. Times are listed below next to the specific location. Please note, for health safety reasons, no one is to exit their vehicle.
Pan Am: 8820 Pendleton Pike, Indianapolis, IN 46226 - Mondays at 11:30 AM
Spring Valley: 8820 Pendleton Pike, Indianapolis, IN 46226 - Mondays at 11:30 AM
Postbrook East Apartments: 9265 East 41st Street, Indianapolis, IN 46235 - Mondays at 11:30 AM
Maison Gardens Apartments: 8808 Rue Madeleine, Indianapolis, IN 46226 - Mondays at 12:15 PM
Oak Ridge: 9530 Pendleton Pike, Indianapolis, IN 46236 -Â Mondays at 12:15 PM
If your family has a significant need for food or other support, you can contact your childâ€™s school directly. If no one is available, leave a message with your information. The phone lines will be monitored Monday â€“ Friday between 8:00 AM and 3:00 PM and a Family Liaison from the MSD Lawrence Township will contact you as soon as possible.
Visit our COVID-19 Community Resources page for additional information and support.
